snippet: The Port Authority opened an inquiry into whether David Wildstein, an ally of Gov. Chris Christie’s, had abused his authority when he ordered bridge access lanes to be closed in September.
abstract: Port Authority opens inquiry into whether New Jersey Gov Chris Christie ally David Wildstein had abused his authority when he ordered sudden closing of three lanes on New Jersey side of George Washington Bridge; officials in Fort Lee, NJ, say shutdown, which caused huge traffic backup, was retaliation against borough's mayor for declining to endorse Christie for re-election.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: The Port Authority opened an inquiry into whether David Wildstein, an ally of Gov. Chris Christie’s, had abused his authority when he ordered bridge access lanes to be closed in September.

headline.main: Port Authority Investigating New Jersey Lane Closings

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
